In three sentences
Comments
Westfield State University is known for its criminal justice program. The on-campus security is everywhere and so aren't the Westfield police, always on and around campus.
There are little no to frats at Westfield, maybe the sports or club team houses located off-campus.

The wrestling club was a great time for me, but there is plenty more. Westfield has great events having bands, guest speakers, and much more in their auditorium. There are various clubs Westfield will be able to match your hobby.
If you have any interests I am sure you with find plenty of people to share them with.
There is the annual pep rally for the footballs homecoming. The big Stanley Park across the street from Westfield has plenty of area to explore.

Westfield State is going to offer you the same college experience you would get at most of the similar colleges. If you choose to live there, and you like it, you will have a great time, but remember your priority is to get educated!

There is plenty to do at Westfield with great athletics, plenty of intramural sports, and tons of clubs to join. The people you meet, you will spend a lot of time with, and adventure down to the Ely building for a good workout or to stop by the library.
The cafeteria at Westfield is...cafeteria food. You will get used to it and sometimes there is a very tasty meal. There are on-campus restaurants that always offer great alternatives.
The dorms are kept tidy and are well secured. The dorms make for a nice experience, and you can decorate your room. There are plenty of fun people to meet at Westfield State.

The college life and work is completely different from what most students are used to, especially those straight out of high school. The college work load will be a big change, but once you are used to it, it can be a great time.
Living on-campus is a blast. You will meet many new, interesting people, and have a great experience. Westfield State is great for students that want to take their education to the next level!
Westfield State University is a great college for eager students. The faculty is great and helps you individually. The diverse students make for some fun around campus!

Also for people who need smaller class sizes and for people who don't want to be just a number. Tips for prospective students Get involved! Talk to people, and get to know your RA he/she can be very helpful and if you have a good relationship with them they can lead you in the right direction with any questions or concerns you may have.
